_comment: Created by EFisher on 25/02/2014 18:17:57 using v2.0
title: How has the frequency of MRSA infections changed?
analysis_commentary:
The rise of new strains of bacteria resistant to common antibiotic treatment has become a major health problem. Staphylococcus aureus that is resistant to the commonly used antibiotic, Methicillin, has come to be a key safety issue in NHS care.

From 2007, the level of hospital acquired MRSA also became a major national concern, similar to C difficile. The number of MRSA cases has reduced by 79% in the six years since this focus in 2007/08.
data_source: Health Protection Agency, Mandatory surveillance of bacteraemia
